data.title: atom.exe location in windows
data.body: I have just installed atom on Windows and would like to know where its executable is located - so that I can point other programs (e.g. Gitbash) to it. I have not selected anything specific during the installation wizard so I guess it should be at some standard location, which, however, I could not find in the documentation.

data.title: Replace pixelated BrowserWindow icon
data.body:
**Update II** We could wait with this since it might get fixed in Atom Shell: https://github.com/atom/atom-shell/issues/863

**Update**: It now only adds a `32px` icon, see https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/5047#issuecomment-69874810

This PR adds icons as `png` in multiple resolutions. See https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4811#issuecomment-69702057

I tested it locally on Windows 8.1. Not by making a new build, but just adding it manually. It seemed to work, but I only have a non hi-res screen. So not sure if it will pick up the 1.5x or 2x version for higher DPIs.

data.title: Paste without formatting/indentation
data.body:
In #1407 @nathansobo wrote:

> I wonder if we should offer a non-normalized variant of paste, like alt-cmd-v.

Opening this issue to ask for the above.

Rationale: I leave auto indentation on, and it (mostly) does the right thing, but sometimes I am moving code around that has indentation rules more complicated than Atom can understand. I'd love to have a quick way to paste the "raw" text without having Atom try to indent it. Kind of like "paste without formatting" in a spreadsheet.

An example of complicated indentation might be a docstring, or PEP8-style indenting to opening parens in Python. Ideally Atom would understand all these rules and do the right thing, but right now I often find myself re-indenting things after Atom strips them during paste.

data.title: Ask if we want metrics enabled on first start, rather than leaving it on by default and not asking
data.body: While metrics can be useful, some of us would prefer not to send extra data over the wire. Could you please set it to ask us if we want to send analytics on start and disable it if we say no, rather than just assuming we do?

data.title: Allow scoped default File Encoding
data.body:
This pull request allows custom configuration for file encoding based on scope descriptors.

For example (my original issue), setting powershell files to UTF16-BE:

```
".powershell":
  core:
    fileEncoding: "utf16be"
```

I have created a package to do this (https://atom.io/packages/default-encoding) which works, however I added this pull request if you guys think it will be useful.

Note this is not in lieu of auto detection, just another way to customise atom.

Thanks

data.title: Font is blurry on retina screens
data.body:
Just updated to 0.172.0 from 0.166.0 and the entire app is now non-retina ready. I've added `-webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;` which smooths the font, but it's still quite blurry and not retina ready.

![screen shot 2015-01-13 at 3 59 31 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1181184/5731837/3d441d66-9b3d-11e4-8da6-4310edea3d69.png)

Looked through the existing issues and only found font issues concerning non-retina devices, but my apologies if this is a repeat.

data.title: API for Creating Custom Gutters
data.body:
## Motivation

The Decorations API allows you to attach a class to gutters (and other things) and thus style them. However, we are working on a feature that requires us to be able to add our own HTML elements to the gutter, and would like to propose an API to do that.

**Feature:**
We would like to add buttons to the gutter next to lines that contain a test definition. Clicking on the button would run that test. (This is similar to functionality in Xcode.)

**Why CSS doesn't work:**
Adding CSS only allows us to create “buttons” via :before or :after pseudo-elements. These elements can't respond to events targeted to them; instead, any events they receive will register on the existing “line-number” gutter element. The gutter element already has another action to take in response to a click: it may expand or collapse a section of code. If we tried to add events to the gutter element itself (instead of a new child div), our events would conflict with the existing events from Atom.

**How the Line Numbers in the Gutter Work, Currently:**
When the editor is scrolled, line-number divs that have scrolled offscreen are removed, and new line-number divs for newly onscreen lines are added. The changes are primarily in the GutterComponent class, in “appendOrUpdateVisibleLineNumberNodes” (which calls into “buildLineNumberHTML”) and “removeLineNumberNodes”.

**Proposed Change:**
1. The most flexibility that an Atom API could offer is the ability to accept a function that will be run on each line-number div after it's added (and before it's removed, for any teardown work). In practice, this could lead to changes that affect things that might be considered “core” to Atom's look. It seems like this opens too much flexibility.
2. A more pared-down API that Atom could offer is the ability to add a column next to the gutter (either on the left side or right side, though it's understandable to limit this to the left side because the right side is occupied by “foldability”). The API for a Gutter object would accept a function that is given the line number, and returns a div for that line number, which would be inserted into the DOM next to the appropriate line number. (It would make sense for this insertion to be done in Atom Core code, because it already manages the positioning of the line numbers and does this via absolute positioning for performance optimisation.) 
## Desired Gutter Features

**Adding Gutters**
- Create gutter
  - You will most likely create one gutter instance per editor instance.
- API to add a gutter to an editor
  - Indicate whether to position it to the left or right of the line numbers
  - Pass a “z-index” of sorts to indicate how close/far from the edge it should be, similar to the “priority” argument to Atom.Workspace.add---Panel.

**Removing Gutters**
- Remove from view (toggle)
- Destroy

**Gutter Properties to Set**
- Set the width (?)

**Modifying Gutter Contents**
- Insert something inside a div next to each line
  - Initialize the Gutter object with a function that operates on a line number and returns a DOM element. As line-number divs are inserted and removed as the user scrolls, this function is run to determine what to place in the custom gutter next to each line number.
  - API could also allow:
    - Changing this function
    - Clear all the items in the gutter (a convenience)
  - For performance, by default, this function could run just once at initialization on the currently-displayed line numbers, and be run on progressively more line numbers as the user scrolls. The results could be cached.
    - The Gutter API should also expose a method that triggers the function to be run on the currently-displayed line numbers, or on a specific line. This could be useful if you want to update the gutter without the editor being scrolled.

data.title: Failed to load keymap.cson and snippets.cson if empty
data.body:
It looks like this has to do with the recent update to [season](https://github.com/atom/season) to stop eval'ing CSON. (Let me know if I should re-open this there.) After upgrading from 0.170.0 to 0.171.0 I got the following errors:

```
SyntaxError: Syntax error on line 39, column 23: One top level value expected
  at nodeTransforms.Block (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/season/node_modules/cson-safe/lib/parse.js:74:15)
  at transformNode (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/season/node_modules/cson-safe/lib/parse.js:199:12)
  at Object.parse (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/season/node_modules/cson-safe/lib/parse.js:205:12)
  at parseObject (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/season/lib/cson.js:34:19)
  at parseContentsSync (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/season/lib/cson.js:42:14)
  at Object.module.exports.readFileSync (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/season/lib/cson.js:110:14)
  at KeymapManager.module.exports.KeymapManager.readKeymap (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/atom-keymap/lib/keymap-manager.js:326:23)
  at KeymapManager.module.exports.KeymapManager.loadKeymap (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/atom-keymap/lib/keymap-manager.js:280:43)
  at KeymapManager.loadUserKeymap (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/src/keymap-extensions.js:37:19)
  at Atom.module.exports.Atom.startEditorWindow (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/src/atom.js:606:20)
  at Object.<anonymous> (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/src/window-bootstrap.js:12:8)
  at Object.<anonymous> (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/src/window-bootstrap.js:23:4)
  at Module._compile (module.js:468:26)
  at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:486:10)
  at Module.load (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/coffee-script/lib/coffee-script/register.js:45:36)
  at Function.Module._load (module.js:318:12)
  at Module.require (module.js:373:17)
  at require (module.js:392:17)
  at window.onload (file:///usr/share/atom/resources/app/static/index.js:66:25)
```

and

```
SyntaxError: Syntax error on line 19, column 2: One top level value expected
  at nodeTransforms.Block (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/season/node_modules/cson-safe/lib/parse.js:74:15)
  at transformNode (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/season/node_modules/cson-safe/lib/parse.js:199:12)
  at Object.parse (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/season/node_modules/cson-safe/lib/parse.js:205:12)
  at parseObject (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/season/lib/cson.js:34:19)
  at parseContents (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/season/lib/cson.js:52:16)
  at /usr/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/season/lib/cson.js:133:23
  at fs.js:295:14
  at Object.oncomplete (fs.js:93:15)
```

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Make sure you're on Atom 0.171.0
2. Make sure `keymap.cson` and `snippets.cson` are empty except for comments (I have the default comments still)
3. Try starting / restarting Atom
4. Try saving `keymap.cson` / `snippets.cson`

**OS:** Ubuntu 14.01.1 LTS
**Atom:** 0.171.0

data.title: Highlight all ocurrences of the selected string in the current file
data.body:
This is a very useful feature provided by Kate editor which I miss when I open I file on Atom.
Any chance it could be implemented?

Here is an example of how it works on Kate: suppose a file contains this

```
foo bar baz
baz foo bar
bar baz foo
```

If I double click on "foo", it gets selected and then all 3 occurrences of "foo" are highlighted. If I unselect "foo", the highlight disappears. If then I select "bar baz", its two occurrences (on lines 1 and 3) get selected.

data.title: :memo: fix ::observeCursors doc
data.body: Change selection -> cursor

data.title: Uncaught Error: ENOENT, open '/Users/Steve/sb/www/spec/workers/amazebot/inventory_report/update_total_listed_products_spec.rb'
data.body:
1. Was working in a Git branch where the file named above existed.
2. Did a `git checkout` to a branch where that file did not exist. 
3. The red error box popped up with a "Create issue" button, so here I am.

This may or may not be related to the quirk I've noticed where Atom will not only keep files open that were removed by a Git checkout, but will autosave them and create them again, making Git think it's a new untracked file.  Other editors I've used seem to do better at closing a file window if the file was removed by outside means.

**Atom Version**: 0.165.0
**System**: Mac OS X 10.10.1
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught Error: ENOENT, open '/Users/Steve/sb/www/spec/workers/amazebot/inventory_report/update_total_listed_products_spec.rb'

data.title: Cursor blinking does not respect system settings
data.body: I'm using Atom 0.169.0 under Windows 8.1. My system settings is not to blink the cursor. However, in Atom this setting is not respected. Would it be possible for Atom to respect the system settings on cursor blinking?
